com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Class EngineObserver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.EngineObserver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observers.IEngineObserver, Observers.IObserver
    public class EngineObserver extends java.lang.Object implements Observers.IEngineObserver
    Provides a base class implementation of the IEngineObserver interface, making private implementation of interface methods optional. The base implementation of each interface method does nothing.

      An asset was deleted from disk and all associated metadata was removed from the db.

      Description copied from interface: Observers.IEngineObserver
      An asset was deleted from disk and all associated metadata was removed from the db. The assetDeleted callback will only be called once for a multi-asset delete operation IAssetManager#deleteAssets(List)
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      aUuid - UUID of the asset that was deleted or the multi-asset delete notification UUID.
      aAssetId - Remote asset id of the asset that was deleted or null for a multi-asset delete.

      engineDidNotStart 
      void engineDidNotStart(java.lang.String reason)
      Virtuoso's download engine service did not start upon request.
      public void engineDidNotStart(java.lang.String reason)
      Description copied from interface: Observers.IEngineObserver
      Virtuoso's download engine service did not start upon request. This is a serious error case which is only caused by some uncommon security cases upon which the service will not start and no downloads will be completed. The reason provided is the exception string, and not suitable for display to consumers.
      Specified by:
      engineDidNotStart in interface Observers.IEngineObserver
      Parameters:
      reason - The reason for not starting.

      proxyPortUpdated 
      void proxyPortUpdated()
      The VirtuosoClientHTTPService proxy has restarted on a different port than it was on previously.
      public void proxyPortUpdated()
      Description copied from interface: Observers.IEngineObserver
      The VirtuosoClientHTTPService proxy has restarted on a different port than it was on previously. This will be because the previous port is not available to bind. This can be used in a player activity or fragment to cause the player to restart the video request based on the updated port and skip back to the previous video position.
      Specified by:
      proxyPortUpdated in interface Observers.IEngineObserver

      See Also:

      settingsError 
      void settingsError(int aFlags)
      This will be called to warn the application if the download engine encounters issues while applying a change in settings.
      public void settingsError(int aFlags)
      Description copied from interface: Observers.IEngineObserver
      This will be called to warn the application if the download engine encounters issues while applying a change in settings. It is primarily intended for changes to ISettings.setDestinationPath(String) which are assessed asynchronously after the settings change.
      The flags argument will indicate the primary issue encountered while using the new settings, which will be an enumerated value from com.penthera.virtuososdk.Common.EngineBlockedReason. It is important to manage errors such as permissions errors or invalid/unmounted filesystems if the SDK is being configured with an absolute path to an external filesystem.
      The flags argument will commonly only contain a single issue which was the first triggered while trying to apply settings. If the settings are blocking the engine from an existing task then a full set of reasons for being blocked can be gained from Virtuoso.getBlockedReasonFlags(). This will not be updated immediately if the engine is not being blocked because there are no assets in the queue.
      Specified by:
      settingsError in interface Observers.IEngineObserver
